intro: Englerocharis calycina var. filiformis, commonly known as the slender-flowered englerocharis, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and often edible plants. The species is characterized by its finely divided, filiform (thread-like) leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
